comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Dated 6/19/[19]26, christening of the current Queen Elizabeth II. Top row, l-to-r: 1. Duke of Connaught, likely Prince Arthur, George V's uncle 2. H.M. the King George V, Elizabeth's paternal grandfather 3. Duke of York, later King George VI, Elizabeth's father 4. Earl of Strathmore, Claude Bowes-Lyon, Elizabeth maternal grandfather Bottom row, l-to-r: 1. (?) Elphinstone, likely Mary Elphinstone, the sister of the Queen Mother, so Elizabeth's aunt 2. H.M. The Queen, Mary of Teck, Elizabeth's paternal grandmother 3. Duchess of York, Elizabeth the Queen mother, with baby 4. Countess of Strathmore, likely Cecilia Bowes-Lyon, Elizabeth's maternal grandmother 5. Princess Mary, Viscountess Lascelles, Elizabeth's aunt

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From www.thediamondjubilee.org/queens-life-introduction "The Queen was born Princess Elizabeth of York at 2.40am on 21 April 1926 at 17 Bruton Street, Mayfair, London. .... The Princess was christened Elizabeth Alexandra Mary in the private chapel at Buckingham Palace. She was named after her mother, while her two middle names are those of her paternal great-grandmother, Queen Alexandra, and paternal grandmother, Queen Mary." And www.royalcollection.org.uk/eGallery/object.asp?exhibition... shows the same picture, dates the christening as May 29, 1926, and describes everyone. Mary Elphinstone and Princess Mary were godmothers as well as aunts.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
